content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Sure! Here's how you might write such a function in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    filter(word -> islowercase(first(word)) && !isempty(word), words)
end
```
In this code, `filter` is a higher-order function that applies a condition to each element of an iterable and returns those elements where the condition holds. In our case, we're filtering out words that are not all lowercase and have at least one character (so they're not empty). The `islowercase(first(word))` part checks if the first character of a word is in lowercase (indicating it doesn't start with a capital letter), while `!isempty(word)` checks if the string has any characters (i.e., it's not an empty string).
